    Ordered monoids #

    This file develops the basics of ordered monoids.

    Implementation details #

    Unfortunately, the number of ' appended to lemmas in this file may differ between the multiplicative and the additive version of a lemma. The reason is that we did not want to change existing names in the library.

    Remark #

    Almost no monoid is actually present in this file: most assumptions have been generalized to Mul or MulOneClass.

    source
    instance Nat.instCovariantClassMulLE :
    CovariantClass ℕ ℕ (fun (x x_1 : ℕ) => x * x_1) fun (x x_1 : ℕ) => x ≤ x_1
    Equations
    • Nat.instCovariantClassMulLE = ⋯
    source
    instance Int.instCovariantClassAddLE :
    CovariantClass ℤ ℤ (fun (x x_1 : ℤ) => x + x_1) fun (x x_1 : ℤ) => x ≤ x_1
    Equations
    • Int.instCovariantClassAddLE = ⋯

            def AddLECancellable {α : Type u_1} [Add α] [LE α] (a : α) :
            Prop

            An element a : α is AddLECancellable if x ↦ a + x is order-reflecting. We will make a separate version of many lemmas that require [ContravariantClass α α (+) (≤)] with AddLECancellable assumptions instead. These lemmas can then be instantiated to specific types, like ENNReal, where we can replace the assumption AddLECancellable x by x ≠ ∞.

            Equations
            • AddLECancellable a = ∀ ⦃b c : α⦄, a + b ≤ a + c → b ≤ c
            Instances For
              source
              def MulLECancellable {α : Type u_1} [Mul α] [LE α] (a : α) :
              Prop

              An element a : α is MulLECancellable if x ↦ a * x is order-reflecting. We will make a separate version of many lemmas that require [ContravariantClass α α (*) (≤)] with MulLECancellable assumptions instead. These lemmas can then be instantiated to specific types, like ENNReal, where we can replace the assumption AddLECancellable x by x ≠ ∞.

              Equations
              • MulLECancellable a = ∀ ⦃b c : α⦄, a * b ≤ a * c → b ≤ c
